privacyPolicyDesc2: This Privacy Policy outlines the practices and policies of AudiobookService ('we,' 'us,' or 'our') regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information when you visit our website, use our services, or interact with us in any other way. We are committed to protecting your privacy and handling your personal information responsibly. Please read this Privacy Policy carefully to understand how we collect, use, and safeguard your personal information.
privacyPolicyDesc4: 1.1 Personal Information: We may collect personal information such as your name, email address, postal address, phone number, and other similar information when you voluntarily provide it to us through our website, contact forms, or when you communicate with us.
privacyPolicyDesc5: 1.2 Automatically Collected Information: We may automatically collect certain information about your device and usage of our website or services. This information may include your IP address, browser type, operating system, referring URLs, and other similar information.
privacyPolicyDesc7: Personal Information: We may use your personal information to provide and improve our services, respond to your inquiries, communicate with you about our products and services, send you marketing communications, and fulfill any other purpose for which you provided the information.
privacyPolicyDesc9: 3.1 Service Providers: We may share your personal information with trusted third-party service providers who assist us in operating our website, conducting our business, and providing our services. These service providers have access to your personal information only to perform specific tasks on our behalf and are obligated to keep it confidential.
privacyPolicyDesc10: 3.2 Legal Requirements: We may disclose your personal information if required by law, government request, court order, or to protect our rights, property, or safety, as well as the rights, property, or safety of others.
privacyPolicyDesc12: We take reasonable measures to protect your personal information from unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction. However, please be aware that no method of transmission over the internet or electronic storage is 100% secure. Therefore, we cannot guarantee the absolute security of your personal information.
privacyPolicyDesc14: You have the right to review, update, or delete your personal information that we hold. You can also opt-out of receiving marketing communications from us by following the unsubscribe instructions provided in the email or by contacting us directly.
privacyPolicyDesc16: Our website may contain links to third-party websites or services. Please note that this Privacy Policy does not apply to those third-party websites or services. We are not responsible for the privacy practices or the content of such websites or services. We encourage you to read the privacy policies of any third parties before providing your personal information.
privacyPolicyDesc18: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. The updated version will be posted on our website with the effective date. We encourage you to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes.
privacyPolicyDesc20: If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding this Privacy Policy or our privacy practices, please contact us at
work1Desc1: A small softwarehouse where I took my first steps in web-development. I mastered the php language and was implemented in Symfony5. At work I was involved in 3 projects:
work1Desc2: 1. The company's internal project to develop an application for managing audiobooks. This project became the inspiration for the topic of my engineering thesis. In creating my portfolio, I also modeled this concept. My system for audiobook management can be seen by logging in by providing your email address at the start of this page.
work1Desc3: 2. FlatApp is an application developed for property management. In its operation operation it referred to the otodom website, it allowed the sale or rental of property, but additionally expanded the owner's ability to manage their apartment. From the landlords' side, it was possible to pay rent or report defects, inconveniences or comments. In addition, outside companies had the the possibility to offer their services in the form of repairs or interior finishing. The application had a rating system for apartments, owners ace their services related to repairs, finishing and renovation of apartments. The FlatApp app was a side project of mine at work, but I took care of its development at the company to which I then moved.
work1Desc4: 3. Omnidev was a project aimed at developers who wanted to sell apartments from their developments, even ones that had not yet been fasted. Buyers had the opportunity to select and buy specific apartments from the construction plan, designated themselves parking spaces or storage units, and apartment finishing packages apartments. Outside companies also offered their services related to repairs, finishing and renovation of apartments. The FlatApp app was a side project of mine at work, but I took care of its development at the company to which I then moved.
work2Desc1: At Vobacom, I continued to develop the Omnidev application, but a big part of the work on this application was its refactoring. In it, I upgraded versions of symfony, php and all packages through a huge amount of deprecation. I also rewrote the very design basis, which made almost no use of Symfony's facilities and was written in pure php. After fixing all the refactoring errors and fixing the previous omissions, the application was developed and completed.
work2Desc2: After I finished working on Omnidev, I was switched to working with Drupal. I dealt with smaller tasks related to bugs, fixes and changes in the operation of various applications, mainly municipal or corporate websites. I also participated in a larger implementation related to an insurance company and its insurance offerings. Unfortunately, I was not introduced to Drupal in any way, As a result, I became discouraged with this crm.
work3Desc1: At the company, he is currently engaged in working on the development of V-desk application implementations. It is application for accountants, which enables the digitization of workflow processes, such as invoices, delegations, contracts and records. Each implementation differs from each other and consists of overbuilding the application engine, depending on the client's needs. I have already worked on more than a dozen implementations from start to finish. In between between working on the V-desk application, I maintain various applications on the based on tasks that the support department reports.
aboutDesc1: Hi. My name is Damian and you have come across my portfolio project.
aboutDesc2: I graduated from engineering studies with a specialization in 'Programming of utility applications' at the AMW in Gdynia. I come from Skępe, but currently I live in Poznań.
aboutDesc3: I am  interested in creating and developing web software. I am a person open to new technologies who would like to develop their skills and broaden their knowledge. I focus on the Symfony framework and in my free time I write in React.
